Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Abysmal \A*bys"mal\, a. Pertaining to, or resembling, an abyss; bottomless; unending; profound. [1913 Webster]
Geology gives one the same abysmal extent of time that astronomy does of space. --Carlyle. [1913 Webster]
abysmal adj 1: very great; limitless; "abysmal misery"; "abysmal stupidity" 2: so deep as to be unmeasurable; "the abyssal depths of the ocean" [syn: {abyssal}, {unfathomable}]
